security: The document references individuals and operational activities, including covert actions and potential links to sensitive matters like the Penkovsky case. Disclosing these details could compromise ongoing or past intelligence operations and expose individuals involved in sensitive activities.
summary: Notes compiled by Daniel A. Parsons (Genzman) on 5-12-78, detailing the career and assignments of an Air Force officer, as well as references to individuals and operations, including potential links to the Penkovsky case.
summary_one_paragraph: These are notes compiled by Daniel A. Parsons (Genzman) on May 12, 1978, which outline the career of an Air Force officer from 1958 to 1974, including assignments in Moscow, Vienna, Munich, and London, with a focus on cultural attach√© roles and involvement in covert actions. The notes also include references to John Sager as a supervisor, Paul Garbleh as a COS, and mentions Dean Rusk and Edward R. Murrow. The document also includes details about individuals related to the Penkovsky case, such as Joe Bulk and Godige Rissenalper, along with notations about IBM file systems for storing operational activities.
title: Daniel A. Parsons Notes
